sph_interpretive_translation: One must reject atheism, criticism of the Vedas, denigration of deities, hatred, hypocrisy, arrogance, anger, harshness, envy, and obstinacy.

Causation arises through conscious rejection of foundational Dharma
Capacity-based responsibility requires purification of internal distortions
Restoration logic operates by removing obstacles to consciousness clarity
Consciousness alignment necessitates abandonment of anti-Dharmic tendencies

IF agent demonstrates dveṣa OR krodha THEN trigger emotional integrity restoration process

supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, any act rooted in atheism, disrespect toward sacred texts, or denigration of divine principles shall automatically invoke a threshold review of the actor's eligibility for positions requiring constitutional or societal authority. Responsibility is determined not by punitive measures but by recalibration of consciousness misalignment.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that distortion originates from ignorance, not malice; anupūrvaśaḥ reveals sequential degradation of consciousness through negative traits; proportional responsibility lies in dissolution of those traits; non-punitive reality rule confirms suffering is never corrective—only awareness restores balance.

final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law executes pure consciousness correction without recourse to punishment. Reality aligns through awareness alone. Dharma is restored.
